scheme_data.schemeName: Abhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance To Destitute Widows
scheme_data.shortDescription: {"id": "ZQyLHI0B1csUTixB8uGU", "fields": {"beneficiaryState": ["Kerala"], "schemeShortTitle": "AS-FADW", "level": "State", "nodalMinistryName": null, "schemeCategory": ["Social welfare & Empowerment", "Women and Child"], "schemeName": "Abhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance To Destitute Widows", "schemeCloseDate": null, "slug": "as-fadw", "briefDescription": "The scheme \u201cAbhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance to Destitute Widows\u201d was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala to provide a safe and better living environment to destitute and homeless widows.", "age": {"widow": {"gte": 50, "lte": 100}}, "tags": ["Widow", "Destitute", "Financial Assistance", "Homeless", "Relative"]}, "highlight": {}}
scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Abhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance To Destitute Widows. It is also known as AS-FADW. The “Abhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance to Destitute Widows” scheme was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala. This scheme aims to provide a safe and better living environment for destitute and homeless widows. Under this scheme, monthly financial assistance will be given to the close relatives of destitute widows who provide protection and shelter to them. In the initial phase, the State Government has accorded Administrative Sanction for providing financial assistance to 200 persons at ₹1,000/- each for 6 months. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Kerala. The implementing agency is District Social Justice Office, Kerala. Additionally, the nodal department is Social Justice Department.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Financial assistance of ₹1000/per month will be provided to the close relatives of destitute widows who provide protection and shelter to them.

Eligibility criteria include: The applicant should be a resident of Kerala State.
   The age limit of the applicant (destitute widow) must be above 50 years.
   The annual family income should be below ₹1,00,000/.
   The applicant should not be receiving a service pension or family pension.
   The applicant should not be a beneficiary of schemes implemented through the Social Justice Department (Aswasakiranam, Samashwasam). The application process is as follows: Step 01: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to visit the nearest District Social Justice Office and collect the application form. The application form can also be downloaded from the official website of the Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala.
Step 02: The applicant needs to fill out the application form completely.
Step 03: The duly filled application form along with supporting documents has to be submitted to the concerned District Social Justice Officers. For more information, please refer to: Official Website: http://swd.kerala.gov.in/scheme-info.php?scheme_id=MTI1c1Y4dXFSI3Z5 Application Form: http://swd.kerala.gov.in/DOCUMENTS/Downloadables/Application%20Forms/13927.pdf Order/Notice: http://swd.kerala.gov.in/DOCUMENTS/Order_new/GOs/13928.pdf Tags associated with the scheme include: Destitute, Financial Assistance, Homeless, Relative, Widow.

sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is Abhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance To Destitute Widows.
It is also known as AS-FADW.
The “Abhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance to Destitute Widows” scheme was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.
This scheme aims to provide a safe and better living environment for destitute and homeless widows.
Under this scheme, monthly financial assistance will be given to the close relatives of destitute widows who provide protection and shelter to them.
In the initial phase, the State Government has accorded Administrative Sanction for providing financial assistance to 200 persons at ₹1,000/- each for 6 months.
The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
It is specifically implemented in Kerala.
The implementing agency is District Social Justice Office, Kerala.
Additionally, the nodal department is Social Justice Department.
The scheme provides the following benefits: Financial assistance of ₹1000/per month will be provided to the close relatives of destitute widows who provide protection and shelter to them.
Eligibility criteria include: The applicant should be a resident of Kerala State.
The age limit of the applicant (destitute widow) must be above 50 years.
The annual family income should be below ₹1,00,000/.
The applicant should not be receiving a service pension or family pension.
The applicant should not be a beneficiary of schemes implemented through the Social Justice Department (Aswasakiranam, Samashwasam).
The application process is as follows: Step 01: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to visit the nearest District Social Justice Office and collect the application form.
The application form can also be downloaded from the official website of the Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala.
Step 02: The applicant needs to fill out the application form completely.
Step 03: The duly filled application form along with supporting documents has to be submitted to the concerned District Social Justice Officers.
For more information, please refer to: Official Website: http://swd.

pdf"}], "schemeImageUrl": "", "detailedDescription_md": "The \u201cAbhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance to Destitute Widows\u201d scheme was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.
This scheme aims to provide a safe and better living environment for destitute and homeless widows.
Under this scheme, monthly financial assistance will be given to the close relatives of destitute widows who provide protection and shelter to them.
In the initial phase, the State Government has accorded Administrative Sanction for providing financial assistance to 200 persons at \u20b91,000/- each for 6 months.
\n", "benefits_md": "\n 1.
Financial assistance of \u20b91000/- per month will be provided to the close relatives of destitute widows who provide protection and shelter to them.

\n\n", "briefDescription": "The scheme \u201cAbhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance to Destitute Widows\u201d was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala to provide a safe and better living environment to destitute and homeless widows.

", "answer": "The destitute widows of Kerala State are eligible to apply under the scheme.
"}, {"question": "Is this scheme only for destitute widows?
", "answer": "Yes, this scheme is only for destitute widows.
"}, {"question": "Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala?
